question: Which is not true regarding Smoke and Sanity Testing?
option3: Smoke and sanity tests can be executed using an automation tool.
option4: When executing both, then first execute sanity testing tests and then smoke Testing.
option1: Sanity Testing is also called tester acceptance testing.
option2: Smoke testing performed on a particular build is also known as a build verification test.

question: Testing beyond normal operational capacity is __________.
White Box Testing is not concern with _________.
Pesticide Paradox principle of testing says that ______________.
option3: Testing is done differently in different context.
option4: Test cases needs to be regularly reviewed and revised.
option1: Clustering modules contain most of the defects.
option2: Finding and Fixing defects does not help if the system built is unstable.

question: When an expected result is not specified in test case template then ___________.
option3: It may be difficult to determine if the test has passed or failed.
option4: We cannot automate the user inputs.
option2: It may be difficult to repeat the test.

question: End result of Software Requirement Analysis is ________.
Bug status is set to postpone due to ________.
option3: The bug may not be the major effect in the software.
option1: Priority of that bug may low.
option2: Lack of time for the release.

question: The expected results of the software is _________________.
option3: Most useful when specified in advance

question: Which is not true?
option3: Error guessing has rules for testing.
option1: Condition coverage is also known as Predicate Coverage
option2: 100% condition coverage does not guarantee 100% decision coverage.
